intro: Draba helleri, commonly known as Heller's whitlow grass, is a small flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with characteristic cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and cool climates. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, appearing in clusters at the top of slender stems. Draba helleri is known for its hardy nature and is often found in high-altitude meadows and slopes.
